intro: Durieua abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian duriea, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
